body_content.explanation: to (cause different substances to) combine, so that the result cannot easily be separated into its parts:
examples: Oil and water don't mix. Even if you shake them together they separate into two layers.
Radioactive material was mixed in/up (with) the effluent.
Mix the eggs into the flour.
In a large bowl, mix together the sugar and raisins.
Shall I mix (= make) you a cocktail?

body_content.explanation: to have or do two or more things, such as activities or qualities, at the same time:
examples: Some people are happy to mix business with/and pleasure, but I'm not one of them.

body_content.explanation: to be with or communicate well with other people:
examples: Do you mix with a wide variety of people in your job?
She mixes very well - I guess that's why she's so popular.

body_content.explanation: to control the amounts of various sounds that are combined on a recording

examples: There was an odd mix of people at Patrick's party.
"She's studying physics and philosophy." "That's an interesting mix."

body_content.explanation: something that is sold in the form of a powder to which a liquid, such as water, can be added later:
a version of a recorded piece of music:
examples: A new mix of their hit single is due to be released early next month.
